title: Nonlinear behaviour of positive ions in normal liquid 3He : a comparison between experiment and a parameterless theoretical prediction.
abstract: We have measured positive ion velocities v in normal liquid 3He as a function of electric field E from l0^4 to 2 x 10^5 V/m for a number of temperatures T and pressures P within 3 < T < 50 mK, 1.6 < P < 29 bar. The highly nonlinear variation of U with E observed for U 5 2k,T/hk, is shown to be in excellent quantitative agreement with the theory recently developed by Fetter and Kurkijarvi and by Bowley

        Nonlinear behaviour of positive ions in normal liquid 3He : a comparison between experiment and a parameterless theoretical prediction.</dc:title><dc:creator>
        Alexander, P. W.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
        McClintock, Peter V. E.</dc:creator><dc:creator>

        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        We have measured positive ion velocities v in normal liquid 3He as a function of electric field E from l0^4 to 2 x 10^5 V/m for a number of temperatures T and pressures P within 3 < T < 50 mK, 1.6 < P < 29 bar. The highly nonlinear variation of U with E observed for U 5 2k,T/hk, is shown to be in excellent quantitative agreement with the theory recently developed by Fetter and Kurkijarvi and by Bowley.</dc:description><dc:date>

(1978) Nonlinear behaviour of positive ions in normal liquid 3He : a comparison between experiment and a parameterless theoretical prediction. Journal of Physics C: Solid State Physics, 11 (22). L881-L885. ISSN 0022-3719</dc:identifier><dc:relation>
